What is the purpose of the OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY flag in Verus?

The OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY flag, with a value of 64, is used to restrict a PBaaS chain or gateway to a single currency. This allows for more control over the currencies that can be used on a specific chain or gateway.

a token, not a native currency
OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY = 64       // for PBaaS chains or gateways to potentially restrict to single currency
OPTION_GATEWAY = 128          // if set, this routes external currencies
OPTION_PBAAS = 256           // this is a PBaaS chain definition
OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER = 512     // this means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices
OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain
OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID
```
./raw_text_input_wiki/release_notes.md
What does the OPTION_GATEWAY flag do in Verus?

The OPTION_GATEWAY flag, with a value of 128, indicates that a chain or gateway is set up to route external currencies. This means that the chain or gateway is configured to handle multiple currencies and facilitate their exchange.

a token, not a native currency
OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY = 64       // for PBaaS chains or gateways to potentially restrict to single currency
OPTION_GATEWAY = 128          // if set, this routes external currencies
OPTION_PBAAS = 256           // this is a PBaaS chain definition
OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER = 512     // this means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices
OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain
OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID
```

What is the purpose of the OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER flag in Verus?

The OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER flag, with a value of 512, indicates that a specific PBaaS gateway is set as the default converter and will publish prices. This means that the gateway is configured to convert between different currencies and provide pricing information.

a token, not a native currency
OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY = 64       // for PBaaS chains or gateways to potentially restrict to single currency
OPTION_GATEWAY = 128          // if set, this routes external currencies
OPTION_PBAAS = 256           // this is a PBaaS chain definition
OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER = 512     // this means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices
OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain
OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID
```

How does the OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER flag affect top-level ID and currency registration in Verus?

The OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER flag, with a value of 1024, controls where top-level ID and currency registration occurs. When this flag is not set on a gateway, registration happens on the launch chain. Otherwise, registration is handled by the gateway itself.

a token, not a native currency
OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY = 64       // for PBaaS chains or gateways to potentially restrict to single currency
OPTION_GATEWAY = 128          // if set, this routes external currencies
OPTION_PBAAS = 256           // this is a PBaaS chain definition
OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER = 512     // this means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices
OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain
OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID
```
./raw_text_input_wiki/release_notes.md
What is the purpose of the OPTION_NFT_TOKEN flag in Verus?

The OPTION_NFT_TOKEN flag, with a value of 2048, is used to create a single satoshi NFT (Non-Fungible Token) token. This token represents control over the root ID and is a unique, non-interchangeable token.

a token, not a native currency
OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY = 64       // for PBaaS chains or gateways to potentially restrict to single currency
OPTION_GATEWAY = 128          // if set, this routes external currencies
OPTION_PBAAS = 256           // this is a PBaaS chain definition
OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER = 512     // this means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices
OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain
OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID
```
